intro: Retinispora obtusa var. breviramea, commonly known as the broad-leafed retinispora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves with a smooth upper surface and a hairy underside. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The varietal form breviramea is distinguished by its shorter, more compact ramification compared to the typical form.
